# IT Team Pull Request

## Description
Please include a summary of the changes and the related issue or requirement.

## Type of Change
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Infrastructure change
- [ ] Configuration change
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Dependency update

## System Impact
- [ ] Frontend changes
- [ ] Backend changes
- [ ] Database changes
- [ ] API changes
- [ ] Infrastructure/DevOps changes
- [ ] Security changes
- [ ] Performance optimization

## Testing
- [ ] Unit tests have been added/updated
- [ ] Integration tests have been added/updated
- [ ] End-to-end tests have been added/updated
- [ ] Manual testing has been completed
- [ ] Regression testing has been performed

## Deployment Considerations
- [ ] Database migrations are included
- [ ] Configuration changes are documented
- [ ] Rollback plan is documented
- [ ] No downtime required
- [ ] Maintenance window required: _____________

## Security & Performance
- [ ] Security best practices have been followed
- [ ] Code has been reviewed for vulnerabilities
- [ ] Performance impact has been assessed
- [ ] Load testing has been performed (if applicable)
- [ ] Monitoring and alerting have been configured

## Infrastructure & Dependencies
- [ ] No new dependencies added
- [ ] New dependencies have been reviewed and approved
- [ ] Infrastructure changes are documented
- [ ] Backward compatibility is maintained

## Documentation
- [ ] Code comments have been added/updated
- [ ] Technical documentation has been updated
- [ ] API documentation has been updated (if applicable)
- [ ] Runbook/operational documentation has been updated
- [ ] Architecture diagrams have been updated (if applicable)

## Code Review Checklist
- [ ] Code follows team coding standards
- [ ] No commented-out code or debug statements
- [ ] Error handling is implemented properly
- [ ] Logging is appropriate and consistent

## Additional Notes
Add any additional context, screenshots, or information that reviewers should know.
